alert.note: Alert for Doddridge; Ritchie; Tyler (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 3:25PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ritchie, northwestern Doddridge and Tyler Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 324 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles south of Middlebourne, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Middlebourne, West Union, Alma, Wick, Mountain, Lima and Canton. This includes Route 50 in West Virginia between mile markers 54 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
